intro: Scutia capensis, commonly known as the Cape scutia, is a shrub native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, round, orange-red fruits that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. Scutia capensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
